Class AbstractSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractSensor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConductivitySensor, pHSensor, TemperatureSensor

    public abstract class AbstractSensor
extends java.lang.Object
    The AbstractSensor represents any type of physical sensor connected to the Arduino. The commonality between all of the sensors is grouped into this class. Future sensors should inherit from this class in the form public final {sensorName} extends AbstractSensor Examples include
    • pHSensor
    • conductivity probe
    • temperature probe
    Since:
    1.8

        public abstract TypeOfMeasurement getType()

      • isMeasuringInstantly

        public boolean isMeasuringInstantly()
        Returns the value of measuringInstantly, indicating whether or not this sensor has been set to measure in intervals or instantaneously.
        Returns:
        true if this sensor is not measuring over intervals of time, false if otherwise
        Since:
        1.8

      • setMeasuringToInstant

        public void setMeasuringToInstant(boolean flag)
        Changes the state of this sensor to be used continuously or only once in a while.
        Parameters:
        flag - true or false to identify if this sensor is set to measure in intervals or not
        Since:
        1.8

      • instantMeasure

        public Measurement instantMeasure(SerialConnection conn)
        Looks at the serial monitor of the Arduino board and retrieves the most recent reading of the corresponding sensor. This method takes a string and passes it to generateMeasurement to be parsed. This correspondence between the methods is desired because each measurement needs to be parsed differently depending on the measurement being reported, eg. pH measurements are printed to the serial monitor in a slightly different format than conductivity measurements.

        More robust solutions should override this method.

        Parameters:
        conn - the handle of the Arduino
        Returns:
        a Measurement representative of the most recent or buffered data transmitted by the Arduino
        Since:
        1.8
        See Also:
        SerialConnection, Measurement

      • generateMeasurement

        protected abstract Measurement generateMeasurement(java.lang.String output)
        This is the abstract method used by instantMeasure and overridden by concrete sensor classes. It creates the actual Measurement that is returned by instantMeasure.
        Returns:
        a Measurement representative of the most recent or buffered data transmitted by the Arduino
        Since:
        1.8
        See Also:
        Measurement
